page.title: 06A Stock Farm in Taddington
page.content: At Beech Farm where we live and at one time was "The Black Bull" public house,we have about seventy five free range Warren hens which my brother usually feeds.We sell the eggs to callers.We also retail from the house about six acres of potatoes planted in April and harvested in the Autumn.This year we are growing Wilja Pentland Crown and Romano. Father also does some contract baling of silage and hay for other farmers.This helps to offset the burden of ever increasing expenditure on machinery. He employs two full-time and two casual workers.All the secretarial work is done by my mother.
